alert.note: Alert for Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Pottawatomie; Riley; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:54PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dickinson, northwestern Geary, Riley, Pottawatomie, Clay, southern Washington and southwestern Marshall Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 953 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Frankfort to 3 miles southwest of Idana. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manhattan, Junction City, Wamego, Clay Center, Blue Rapids, Westmoreland, Blaine, Ogden, Solomon, Wakefield, Riley, Waterville, St. George, Clifton, Milford, Leonardville, Linn, Olsburg, Belvue and Morganville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 267 and 268. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for central, north central, northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Pottawatomie; Riley; Washington
